greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of labeled simple graphs with n vertices and spanning edge-connectivity k.
comment: The spanning edge-connectivity of a graph is the minimum number of edges that must be removed (without removing incident vertices) to obtain a disconnected or empty graph.
We consider a graph with one vertex and no edges to be disconnected.
xref: Column k = 0 is A054592, if we assume A054592(1) = 1.
The unlabeled version (except with offset 1) is A263296.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 23 2019
